dsnf-dialog-title: Delete all contents with name <1> {{fileName}} </1> in <3> {{workingDirectory}} </3>
fp.te.db.defaultPassword: We'll use <1> {{password}} </1> as password for decompressing by default
BulkModification.Processor.Editor.Operat: Delete <1/> character(s) <3/> from the  <5/>  position from  <7/>
category.displayNameTemplate.propertyExa: To add a property value as a variable in the template, you can use the following format: <1>{name of property}</1>. For example, <3>{{{samplePropertyName}}}</3> will be replaced with the value of the property named <5>{{samplePropertyName}}</5>
ErrorHandlingModal.FindContactInConfigur: You can find the concat at the bottom of <1>Configuration page</1>
FeatureRequestTip.Developing: The <1>{{name}}</1> feature is under development. You can urge the author or make suggestions on <3>Github</3> or <5>QQ group</5>
FeatureRequestTip.Deprecated: The <1>{{name}}</1> feature has been deprecated. If you need this feature, please propose it on <3>Github</3> or <5>QQ group</5>
FeatureRequestTip.Deprecating: The <1>{{name}}</1> feature will be deprecated. If you need this feature, please propose it on <3>Github</3> or <5>QQ group</5>
This feature is in beta and may be unsta: This feature is in beta and may be unstable. Please report any issues you encounter.
This feature is deprecated and may be re: This feature is deprecated and may be removed in future versions. Please consider using the recommended alternative.
Move {{count}} resources to media librar: Move {{count}} resources to media library (Including file system entries)
Move to media library (Including file sy: Move to media library (Including file system entries)
Move {{count}} resources to media librar: Move {{count}} resources to media library (Data only)
Delete all files with same name in worki: Delete all files with same name in working directory [{{workingDirectory}}]
{{job}} will be started once an hour aut: {{job}} will be started once an hour automatically, but you can trigger it manually by clicking there.
Found top {{count}} resources. (shows up: Found top {{count}} resources. (shows up to 100 results)
{{count}} possible conflicts segment con: {{count}} possible conflicts segment configurations are found.
After your deselection, the current file: After your deselection, the current file will not be treat as a resource, and you need reset the Resource part from path segments, are you sure to remove file type: {{ext}}?
Multiple invalid capturing group names a: Multiple invalid capturing group names are found: {{names}}
Layer: the {{layer}} layer to the last: Layer: the {{layer}} layer to the last
Are you sure to migrate [{{target}}] to: Are you sure to migrate [{{target}}] to [{{property}}]?
Found {{count}} data, and {{changedDataC: Found {{count}} data, and {{changedDataCount}} data will be modified or deleted
Found {{count}} data, and all of them wi: Found {{count}} data, and all of them will be retained
Edit display name template for category: Edit display name template for category {{name}}
This enhancer enhanced this resource at: This enhancer enhanced this resource at {{enhancedAt}}.
{{text}} will be the preferred text in m: {{text}} will be the preferred text in merged groups, you can change the preferred text by clicking the text.
All selected alias groups will be merged: All selected alias groups will be merged into one, and the final preferred is {{preferred}}, are you sure?
Value is being referenced in {{count}} p: Value is being referenced in {{count}} places
Delete all enhancement records of this e: Delete all enhancement records of this enhancer for category {{categoryName}}
Removing all filesystem entries in {{wor: Removing all filesystem entries in {{workingDirectory}} that have the same names as the {{count}} selected filesystem entries
Re-apply all enhancement data of this en: Re-apply all enhancement data of this enhancer for category {{categoryName}}
Are you sure you want to delete {{count}: Are you sure you want to delete {{count}} resources?
We will automatically convert the value: We will automatically convert the value from {{fromType}} to {{toType}}.
Auto group internal items in {{count}} s: Auto group internal items in {{count}} selected directories
StandardValueConversionLoss.NotEmptyValu: Non-empty value will be converted to 'true'
StandardValueConversionLoss.OnlyFirstVal: Only the first value will be retained
StandardValueConversionLoss.NonZeroValue: Non-zero value will be converted to 'true'
StandardValueConversionLoss.TagGroupAndN: Tag group and name will be merged

SearchOperation.In.description: Property value is in the specified value list
SearchOperation.NotIn.description: Property value is not in the specified value list
Are you sure to delete variable {{name}}: Are you sure to delete variable {{name}}?
If you are browsing {{thirdPartyName}},: If you are browsing {{thirdPartyName}}, you should decrease the threads of downloading.
media-library-template.use-preset-templa: We recommend using our <1>Preset Template Builder</1> the first time you create a media library template
Select all {{count}} filtered resources: Select all {{count}} filtered resources (including those not currently loaded).
FileNameModifier.Title: Batch File Name Modification
FileNameModifier.FilePathsPlaceholder: One complete file path per line
FileNameModifier.Validation.ReplaceRequi: Replace operation requires Text or TargetText
FileNameModifier.Validation.InsertRequir: Insert operation requires valid position index
FileNameModifier.Error.InsertTextRequire: Insert operation requires text or target text
FileNameModifier.Error.ReplaceTextRequir: Replace operation requires text or target text
FileNameModifier.Error.NoValidOperation: No valid operation configured. Please add at least one valid operation.
Enhancement.DeleteAllByEnhancerForTempla: Delete all enhancements of this enhancer for template {{templateName}}
This will delete all enhancements of resources in all media libraries using this template.
Enhancement.DeleteByEnhancer.SelectEnhan: Select an enhancer to delete enhancements
MediaLibrary.Name: Name
MediaLibrary.SaveAllConfirm: Deleted media libraries will not be restored. Are you sure you want to save?
MediaLibrary.SearchResources: Search resources in current media library
MediaLibrary.LeavePageConfirm: Are you sure you want to leave the current page?
MediaLibrary.NoMediaLibrariesFound: No media libraries found. You must add at least one media library and synchronize it to manage your resources.
Resource will be displayed only after sy: Resource will be displayed only after synchronization is complete.
Would you like to synchronize now, or do: Would you like to synchronize now, or do it later manually?
Are you sure you want to mark these libr: Are you sure you want to mark these libraries as synced?
Following media libraries may be outdate: Following media libraries may be outdated and should be synchronized:
FileNameModifier.EmptyOperationsHint: No operations yet. Add one to get started.
FileNameModifier.Error.DeleteCountRequir: Delete count is required and must be greater than 0
FileNameModifier.Error.AlphabetCountRequ: Count is required and must be greater than 0
BetaFeature.BackupWarning: If you are processing important data, it is recommended to back it up before trying.
Add selected tasks to the queue: Add selected tasks to the queue
Default path where downloads will be sav: Default path where downloads will be saved
Request interval help: Set the time interval between requests to avoid too frequent requests
Define how downloaded files should be na: Define how downloaded files should be named
In general, it's not necessary to create: In general, it's not necessary to create identical tasks.
Retry automatically when the downloading: Retry automatically when the downloading task failed.
Set a page range if you don't want to do: Set a page range if you don't want to download them all.
This feature is currently in development: This feature is currently in development and may not be fully functional.
DevelopingFeature.ExpectChanges: Please expect updates in the future.
Unable to retrieve Bilibili favorites. P: Unable to retrieve Bilibili favorites. Please ensure your cookie is correctly set and that you have at least one favorite created.
This function is not working because Lux: This function is not working because Lux is not found, check it in system configurations
This function is not working because FFm: This function is not working because FFmpeg is not found, check it in system configurations
You can set the previous downloading che: You can set the previous downloading checkpoint manually to make the downloader start the downloading task from it.
In most cases, you should let this field: In most cases, you should let this field set by downloader automatically.
Each downloader has its own checkpoint f: Each downloader has its own checkpoint format, and invalid checkpoint data will be ignored. You can find samples on our online document.
Layer 0 is {{basePathType}}, negative me: Layer 0 is {{basePathType}}, negative means before {{basePathType}}, positive means after {{basePathType}}
Extract property values from resource pa: Extract property values from resource path
For layer-based rules, level 0 represent: For layer-based rules, level 0 represents the current directory; for regex rules, the text to be matched starts from the next level under the current directory up to the resource path portion.
All rules will be run independently, and: All rules will be run independently, and the results will be merged
Configure media players for different fi: Configure media players for different file types
No players configured. Click 'Add Player: No players configured. Click 'Add Player' to get started.
Use {0} as placeholder for the file path: Use {0} as placeholder for the file path
Please fill in all executable paths befo: Please fill in all executable paths before saving.
This script modifies some interactive be: This script modifies some interactive behaviors of the target website. You can manually enable or disable the script in Tampermonkey.
Left-clicking on covers or post titles w: Left-clicking on covers or post titles will trigger the creation of a post parsing task on Bakabase. You can still use the middle button to open posts.
Left-clicking on covers will trigger the: Left-clicking on covers will trigger the creation of a torrent download task on Bakabase. You can still use the middle button to open posts.
Bind referenced properties to current te: Bind referenced properties to current template?
You can set a proxy for network requests: You can set a proxy for network requests, such as socks5://127.0.0.1:18888
Prefer pre-release version which has new: Prefer pre-release version which has new features but less stability
We are using Microsoft Clarity to track: We are using Microsoft Clarity to track anonymous data, which will help us to improve our product experience.
The configurable port range is {{min}}-{: The configurable port range is {{min}}-{{max}}. And you can set it to 0 for auto count.
Changes will take effect after restartin: Changes will take effect after restarting the application
Please be careful when setting this valu: Please be careful when setting this value, if you set it to a value that is already in use by another application, our application will not be able to start.
You can set fixed listening ports.
Enter ports separated by commas, e.g. 34: Enter ports separated by commas, e.g. 34567, 34568
Too many ports. Up to {{max}} ports are: Too many ports. Up to {{max}} ports are supported.
You can configure the number of listenin: You can configure the number of listening ports. The more listening ports you set, the more it helps with parallel processing of interface‑related operations. It’s recommended not to exceed the number of CPU cores. In most cases, you can just ignore this setting. If you leave it as empty and listening ports are not specified, we'll use a default value.
ResourceCover.CoverTips.Title: No covers loaded? Tips
ResourceCover.CoverTips.S1.Title: Situation 1: No cover can be generated
ResourceCover.CoverTips.S1.When.NotImage: the resource is not an image itself.
ResourceCover.CoverTips.S1.When.NoImageI: there is not any image in resource's folder
ResourceCover.CoverTips.S1.Todo.FFmpeg: if resource is video, you can setup ffmpeg in configuration to auto capture screenshot as covers;
ResourceCover.CoverTips.S1.Todo.Enhancer: setup enhancers in media library template and wait the enhancements complete, enhancers may fill everything including property values and files they can acquired for each resources.
ResourceCover.CoverTips.S1.Todo.Cache: sometimes you may should clear cache or disable cache after above operations.
ResourceCover.CoverTips.S2.Title: Situation 2: Cached cover was deleted
ResourceCover.CoverTips.S2.When.CacheDel: the cover was cached but deleted after
ResourceCover.CoverTips.S2.Todo.DisableC: try to disable cache from the button inside upper right area of current page, if covers display, you can manually remove caches in data-cache page
MediaLibrary.DeleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this media library?
MediaLibrary.EmptyState.Title: No Media Libraries Yet
MediaLibrary.EmptyState.Description: Media libraries help you categorize your resources. Create a media library and assign resources to it via path marks.
MediaLibrary.EmptyState.Feature1: Create media libraries to categorize your resources (e.g., Movies, TV Shows, Music)
MediaLibrary.EmptyState.Feature2: Assign resources to media libraries using path marks - resources can belong to multiple libraries
MediaLibrary.EmptyState.Feature3: Each library has its own name and color for easy identification
MediaLibrary.ListDescription: Click on library name to edit, use color picker to customize
MediaLibrary.PathMarkConfigHint: Want to assign resources to media libraries?
MediaLibrary.Term.Suggestion: We recommend creating at least one media library and associating your resources with it to help manage your content.
Show operations after playing first file: Show operations after playing first file
Usually this will work fine if you are c: Usually this will work fine if you are categorizing files.
{{count}} resource(s) have set this prop: {{count}} resource(s) have set this property value.
{{count}} resource(s) loaded in this med: {{count}} resource(s) loaded in this media library.
You can perform chained enhancement by c: You can perform chained enhancement by customizing the execution order of the enhancers.
Generally, you can just leave it as empt: Generally, you can just leave it as empty.
Generally, this enhancer will use file/f: Generally, this enhancer will use file/folder name of resource to perform enhancement and its not necessary to change this.
In some cases, you can change the proper: In some cases, you can change the property value used during enhancement to perform enhancement on other property values.
Property value scope usually means who t: Property value scope usually means who the property value is generated by.
For internal options, property value sco: For internal options, property value scope will be ignored.
Manual property value scope has been sel: Manual property value scope has been selected
Please select at least one property to e: Please select at least one property to enhance.
Pick a directory or file path: Pick a directory or file path
Validate your template on sample resourc: Validate your template on sample resources and see live traces.
Run a quick validation to check resource: Run a quick validation to check resource discovery, properties, playable files, enhancers and display names.
A hidden .bakabase.json file will be gen: A hidden .bakabase.json file will be generated inside folder resources to store their resource IDs.
During synchronization, if a folder path: During synchronization, if a folder path changes but contains a .bakabase.json with any matching resource IDs, the resource data will be preserved instead of creating a new resource.
Since a path can be added to multiple me: Since a path can be added to multiple media libraries, resources under each path will be tracked per media library.
Only supports resources in new version (: Only supports resources in new version (V2) media libraries. Legacy resources (category-based media libraries) are not supported.
Enabling this feature will increase sync: Enabling this feature will increase synchronization time as marker files need to be generated and verified.
This feature will work after a complete: This feature will work after a complete GenerateResourceMarker task finishes.
The KeepResourcesOnPathChange task is cu: The KeepResourcesOnPathChange task is currently running.
Disabling this feature will stop the tas: Disabling this feature will stop the task. Are you sure you want to continue?
Do you want to delete all .bakabase.json: Do you want to delete all .bakabase.json marker files?
If you keep them, existing markers will: If you keep them, existing markers will remain in the folders.
By default, when a folder path changes,: By default, when a folder path changes, the resource data will be created as a new resource.
If you enable this feature, a hidden .ba: If you enable this feature, a hidden .bakabase.json file will be generated inside folder resources to store their resource IDs.
Term.Resource.Description: A resource is the fundamental unit in Bakabase. It represents a media item such as a movie, music album, game, or image collection.
Term.Resource.Usage: Almost all operations in Bakabase are resource-based. You can add, edit, or remove property values for any resource.
Term.Resource.Tip: Tip: Avoid using many small files as individual resources (e.g., tens of thousands of separate images). This can slow down the system and make management difficult.
Term.Enhancer.Description: Plugins that automatically populate resource properties or download additional files (covers, subtitles, etc.) from external sources.
Term.Property.Description: A property is an attribute that can be assigned to resources. Properties help you organize and categorize your media items.
Term.Property.Usage: Use property marks to automatically extract and assign property values from file paths based on patterns or rules.
Match items at a specific folder level r: Match items at a specific folder level relative to this path
Match items whose path matches the regul: Match items whose path matches the regular expression pattern
No matches found. Please check your conf: No matches found. Please check your configuration.
PathMark.Layer.Description: 0 = current directory, positive = down (1=first subdirectory, 2=second...), negative = up (-1=parent, -2=grandparent...)
PathMark.Regex.Description: Matches against relative paths of sub-items using / as separator. Any matched path is treated as a resource. To skip N levels, prefix with: [^/]+/ (repeat N times).
PathMark.ApplyScope.MatchedOnly.Descript: Only applies to paths that directly match the condition. Example: If layer=1 matches 'Videos/Movies', only 'Videos/Movies' itself will be marked, not 'Videos/Movies/Action' or other subdirectories.
PathMark.ApplyScope.MatchedAndSubdirecto: Applies to matched paths and all their subdirectories recursively. Example: If layer=1 matches 'Videos/Movies', both 'Videos/Movies' and all contents like 'Videos/Movies/Action', 'Videos/Movies/Comedy/film.mp4' will be marked.
PathRuleConfig.Description: Browse and select folders or files below, then use 'Add Mark' button to configure resource or property marks. Right-click on existing marks to delete them. Once marks are synced, you can view and use the resources in the Resources page.
Select marks to copy from an entry: Select marks to copy from an entry
When enabled, marks will be synced immed: When enabled, marks will be synced immediately after creation
When enabled, marks will be synced immediately after being set.
Note: If there is a lot of data, synchro: Note: If there is a lot of data, synchronization may take several minutes.
Click to edit, right-click to delete: Click to edit, right-click to delete
After sync completes, the mark will be r: When marks apply to subdirectories, changes to files or folders within sub-paths may not be detected in time. Enabling this feature will automatically re-sync the mark after the specified time to ensure data consistency. Note: If the interval is set too short, it may cause frequent re-syncing and affect performance.
Sync all marks on this path: Sync all marks on this path
PathMark.Priority.Description: Higher values take precedence. Marks with higher priority override lower priority ones for the same property. When priorities are equal, marks closer to the resource path take precedence
PathMark.Resource.Explanation: Match Mode and Apply Scope work together with Resource Filters to determine which files or folders will be marked as resources. Adjust these settings to precisely control resource discovery.
PathMark.Resource.IsResourceBoundary.Des: When enabled, resource marks from parent directories will not apply to paths under this mark. Use this for directories with different resource granularity.
PathMark.Property.Explanation: Match Mode and Apply Scope work together to determine which resources will receive the property you are configuring. The preview below shows which resources will be affected.
PathMark.Property.SettingsDescription: Select which property to assign and configure its value.
PathMark.MediaLibrary.Explanation: Match Mode and Apply Scope work together to determine which resources will be associated with the media library. The preview below shows which resources will be affected.
PathMark.MediaLibrary.SettingsDescriptio: Choose how to determine the target media library for matched resources.
Are you sure you want to delete this mar: Are you sure you want to delete this mark?
View and manage all path marks across yo: View and manage all path marks across your media libraries. Click on a path to edit marks in the config page.
Go to path mark config page to add marks: Go to path mark config page to add marks
Delete all marks on this path: Delete all marks on this path
Click on folders to navigate. Use the Ad: Click on folders to navigate. Use the Add Mark button or right-click for mark options.
Cannot transfer to the same path: Cannot transfer to the same path
Optional regex to extract media library: Optional regex to extract media library name. Uses first capture group or full match.
No resources matched by this criteria: No resources matched by this criteria
Other settings can be configured directl: Other settings can be configured directly in the table after creation.
Files with these extensions will be cons: Files with these extensions will be considered playable
Regex pattern to match playable file nam: Regex pattern to match playable file names (optional, leave empty for extension-only matching)
Please select a file, not a folder: Please select a file, not a folder
Use {0} as placeholder for the file path: Use {0} as placeholder for the file path. Example: --fullscreen {0}
This player will be used for files with: This player will be used for files with these extensions
Enter a file path to preview the command: Enter a file path to preview the command
Note: The test path is a folder, not a f: Note: The test path is a folder, not a file
Please fill in all executable paths befo: Please fill in all executable paths before saving.
Edit display name template for resources: Edit display name template for resources
Wrappers around empty property values wi: Wrappers around empty property values will be removed automatically.
Enter template or click properties above: Enter template or click properties above to insert...
Leave empty to use filename as display n: Leave empty to use filename as display name.
Delete enhancements for resources matchi: Delete enhancements for resources matching profile
This profile has no enhancers configured: This profile has no enhancers configured. All enhancements for matching resources will be deleted.
Only delete enhancement records that hav: Only delete enhancement records that have no actual enhancement data
Warning: This action cannot be undone.
Click here to create a new resource prof: Click here to create a new resource profile. Each profile defines settings for a group of resources.
This table shows all your resource profi: This table shows all your resource profiles. Profiles with higher priority are matched first.
Search Criteria: Define which resources: Search Criteria: Define which resources this profile applies to. Use filters like media library, properties, or tags.
Name Template: Customize how resource na: Name Template: Customize how resource names are displayed using property placeholders like {Name}.
Enhancers: Plugins that automatically fe: Enhancers: Plugins that automatically fetch metadata or download additional files from external sources.
Playable Files: Rules to identify which: Playable Files: Rules to identify which files are playable, by extension or filename pattern.
Players: Configure external applications: Players: Configure external applications to open playable files.
Properties: Select which properties shou: Properties: Select which properties should be displayed for matching resources.
Are you sure you want to delete this res: Are you sure you want to delete this resource profile?
Name: Name
A unique name to identify this profile.
Customize how resource names are display: Customize how resource names are displayed using property placeholders like {Name}. Leave empty to use the original filename.
Rules to identify which files within a r: Rules to identify which files within a resource are playable. Configure by file extension or filename pattern.
External applications to open playable f: External applications to open playable files. You can assign different players for different file extensions.
Select which properties should be displa: Select which properties should be displayed or editable for resources matching this profile.
Higher priority profiles are matched fir: Higher priority profiles are matched first. When multiple profiles match a resource, the one with highest priority takes effect.
onboarding.welcome.title: Welcome to Bakabase
onboarding.welcome.description: A powerful local media resource management tool that helps you organize, enhance, and enjoy your media collection.
onboarding.pathMark.title: Configure Resource Paths
onboarding.pathMark.subtitle: Define which folders contain your resources and how they should be organized.
onboarding.pathMark.point1: Mark any folder as a resource location
onboarding.pathMark.point2: Set custom properties for automatic extraction
onboarding.resourceProfile.title: Customize Resource Display
onboarding.resourceProfile.subtitle: Configure how your resources are displayed and processed.
onboarding.resourceProfile.point2: Set up enhancers to auto-fill metadata
onboarding.resourceProfile.point3: Configure media players for different file types
onboarding.resourceBrowsing.title: Browse and Manage
onboarding.resourceBrowsing.subtitle: Use powerful filtering and search to find your resources.
onboarding.resourceBrowsing.point1: Build complex filter rules with multiple conditions
onboarding.resourceBrowsing.point2: Sort and group resources by any property
onboarding.resourceBrowsing.point3: Grid view mode for intuitive resource browsing
onboarding.fileProcessor.title: File Processor
onboarding.fileProcessor.subtitle: Quick tools to process and organize your files.
onboarding.fileProcessor.point1: One-click extraction for any compressed file
onboarding.fileProcessor.point2: Batch process multiple files at once
onboarding.fileProcessor.point3: Wrap, group, and organize files easily
onboarding.downloader.title: Downloader
onboarding.downloader.subtitle: Download resources from your favorite sites.
onboarding.downloader.point1: Download Bilibili videos with one click
onboarding.downloader.point2: Support for Pixiv, ExHentai and more
onboarding.fileMover.title: File Mover & Renamer
onboarding.fileMover.subtitle: Automate file organization and batch renaming.
onboarding.fileMover.point1: Set up rules to auto-move files to destinations
onboarding.fileMover.point2: Batch rename files with powerful patterns
onboarding.completion.title: You're All Set!
onboarding.completion.description: Start exploring Bakabase and manage your media collection with ease.
onboarding.completion.hint: You can view this guide again from Settings
resourceProfileGuide.welcome.title: Resource Profiles
resourceProfileGuide.welcome.description: Resource Profiles allow you to customize how different resources are displayed, enhanced, and played. Create profiles with specific criteria to apply different settings to different types of resources.
resourceProfileGuide.matching.title: Matching Resources
resourceProfileGuide.matching.subtitle: Define which resources each profile applies to.
resourceProfileGuide.matching.point1: Use search criteria to match resources by media library, properties, tags, or other conditions.
resourceProfileGuide.matching.point2: Higher priority profiles are matched first. When multiple profiles match, the one with highest priority takes effect.
resourceProfileGuide.display.title: Display & Enhancement
resourceProfileGuide.display.subtitle: Customize how resources appear and get enhanced.
resourceProfileGuide.display.point1: Create custom display name templates using property placeholders like {Name}.
resourceProfileGuide.display.point2: Configure enhancers to automatically fetch metadata or download additional files from external sources.
resourceProfileGuide.display.point3: Select which properties should be displayed for matching resources.
resourceProfileGuide.playback.title: Playback Settings
resourceProfileGuide.playback.subtitle: Configure how media files are played.
resourceProfileGuide.playback.point1: Define which files are playable by extension or filename pattern.
resourceProfileGuide.playback.point2: Assign different external players for different file types.
